de.systemagmbh.interfaces.logger
Interface ISysLogger

All Superinterfaces:
ISysComponent, ISysLog
All Known Implementing Classes:
ASysLogger, DummyISysLogger
public interface ISysLogger
extends ISysLog, ISysComponent

The interface ISysLogger defines all methods for working with a logger.

The init() method allows the implementation of ISysLogger to initialise itself from the configuration. It is loading the ISysLogChecker, the ISysLogFormatter and the ISysLogWriter. If one of these parts can not be loaded from the configuration a CSysLoggerException is thrown.
The call of the log() method will use the checker, the formatter and the writer in its defined way. This should lead to the expected log result. Otherwise the configuration data was not complete or the used logger is not working properly.
Using the get methods allows the usage of each single part of the logger from outside. In this way the writer can be called without performing the check of the loaded ISysLogChecker.
The allowed values for the log level are listed in ISysLogConstants .
Before closing the logger the close() method has to be called.
The more comfortable way of using the ISysLogger instance is the static class CSysLog (See there for more information about usage.).

The logging component should implement ISysLogConstants to have simple access to the log levels to be used and the boolean DEV_LOG.

Usage: 

 	
 	//-- First load the configuration and get the config item that
 	//-- contains the data for the logger:
 	ISysConfigItem configItem = ...;

  //-- Let's first load the logger:
  ISysLogger logger = FSysLogger.createLogger(configItem);

  //-- Now we can log via the logger:
 	logger.log("TheComponentType", "This is only interesting while developing.", ALL, null);

 	//-- Let's register the logger at CSysLog:
 	CSysLog.setISysLog(logger);

 	//-- Now we can log via CSysLog:
 	CSysLog.log("TheComponentType", "This is only interesting while developing.", ALL);

  //-- If developper info has to be logged use DEV_LOG:
 	if(DEV_LOG)
 	.	CSysLog.log("TheComponentType", "This is only interesting while developing.", ALL);

ATTENTION:

The components will always log via CSysLog. They can not support the usage of a individual logger within an application.

Version:
$Revision: 1.22 $
Author:
Udo Friedrich, Torsten Knauft
